Linux Mint's Ubuntu-based editions have much in common with their parent Ubuntu releases, from the [[Computer software|software]] repositories of which they build.<ref name="aboutmint">{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxmint.com/about.php |title=About |publisher=Linux Mint |date=2007-09-24 |accessdate=2009-07-16}}</ref> For instance, release 6 (âFeliciaâ) uses the package pools of Ubuntu 8.10 (âIntrepid Ibexâ).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linuxmint.com/blog/?p=560 |title=The Linux Mint Blog Â» Blog Archive Â» Mint 6 Review: Dedoimedo |publisher=Linuxmint.com |date=2009-01-19 |accessdate=2009-07-16}}</ref>
Linux Mint has a stated focus on elegance, and it includes a number of applications that are not available in Ubuntu, and vice versa. Mint has a number of design differences from Ubuntu, including:
